Live in the #1 University Housing among all California college campuses




Why Live at SSU



















 
Move Out 2023


Students, please be aware that the deadline to move out is 24 hours after your last final. Students who have a final on Friday of Finals Week are required to move out no later than 11:00 a.m. on May 20, 2023. Before you move out, make sure to change your mailing address, recycle, donate, and, throw away trash, and restore your residence. For more information, visit the Move Out webpage.



  







REACH Home

Announcements



  '23 Summer Housing: Applications for summer housing are still being accepted! Apply on the Housing Portal.

Learn more about Summer Housing!
   

  ‘23-‘24 Housing Applications for Current Students: On-Campus applications for current students are still being accepted! Apply on the Housing Portal.   

  ‘23-‘24 Housing Applications for Incoming Students: Applications for incoming students are still being accepted! Apply on the Housing Portal.

Learn more about New Resident - Applications. 
   









Your Sonoma Home 
When you live on campus at Sonoma State University, you are able to experience college life and take advantage of the opportunities and resources right outside your door. Living on campus is a place to call home where friends are made, ideas are created and memories last a lifetime.
Sonoma State University is number one in university housing among all California college campuses. Our housing options are far from ordinary, with open and spacious living spaces that include suite-style and apartment-style housing. You can enjoy your own room and bathroom, and benefit from countless opportunities for social interaction, academic growth, and community engagement. At SSU, we take pride in our welcoming and inclusive housing, and we offer options that cater to diverse needs and preferences. Experience the best college life at SSU, where you will find a community that truly cares about YOU!
Apply For Housing

Being an on campus student my Freshman and Sophomore year was the best decision I could have made while at Sonoma State. Everything I needed was just a short walk away and I had so many opportunities to get more involved on campus. The best part by far was being able to live in suite style housing with some of my closest friends and making memories that will last a lifetime!





Sophia Siotos | Business Administration Major, Marketing Concentration



 
   





 


Living on campus allowed me to meet other students and find my best friends at SSU! Not only was living on campus convenient, but I was able to get involved on campus and enjoy all that Sonoma State has to offer.





Casey Fabbri | Communications Major



 
   





 


Living on campus allows you to feel apart of campus life while meeting new people who live around you. Campus living is a great option if you are wanting to meet new people or find new interests.





Cole Bertrand | Business Administration Major



 
   





 


I chose to live on campus my freshman year to make friends and stay involved in campus life and it was the best decision I could've made! It helped me find my best friend / current roommates & made the transition into college life so much easier. Don't miss your opportunity!





Sidney Adame | Liberal Studies Major, Chemistry Minor



 
   





 


The best part about being on campus was the simple five minute walk to everything I needed: the Rec, Kitchens, work, and classes all within a few strides of each other. In addition, the common living room and lawns made feeling involved and knowing my village mates so much easier and better!





Sean Kenneally | Communications and Environmental Studies Major



 
   





 


Living on campus with my friends offered me the ability to fully immerse myself in all things SSU. I was surrounded by roommates who turned into my best friends because of all of the long lasting memories we made while living together. Deciding to live on campus was one of the best decisions I ever made.





Matille Goldstein | Business Administration and Psychology Major



 
   





 


Not only was living on campus beautiful and convenient, but it also gave me the opportunity to meet some of my best friends! Living in the residential communities helped us all build a community and made SSU feel like home. Roomies by chance, besties by choice!





Caitlin Aaron-Vadnais | Communications Major, English Minor



 
   





 


I prefer to live on campus because it makes going to classes, attending events, and work a lot easier. By living on campus I was also able to meet a lot more people that I never would have met. By staying in the residential areas it helps and motivates you to be more involved on campus as well as the community. 





Alexis Perez | Business Administration Major, Finance Concentration 



 
   





 


Living on campus was the best part of Sonoma. It’s like living in nice apartments with only your friends as neighbors. Having your own bathroom and full kitchen makes the experience much better.





Grant Malmquist | Business Major, Marketing Concentration 



 
   





 


Living on campus has made my college experience unforgettable! I loved the convenience of being a walk away from anything you need, whether it's class, the Kitchens, or the Rec! I especially enjoyed having my own room and bathroom. I can definitely see why SSU Housing is ranked #1!





Valentina Hidalgo | Business Administration Major, Marketing Concentration



 
   





 


Living on campus all four years of my college career has been a great experience. I had the opportunity of living in the First Generation designated housing. As a First Gen student, this was a great way to make connections with people with the same drive and empowerment, as well as, have a support system that helps navigate you through your educational and personal journey.





Evelyn Munguia | Women’s and Gender Studies Major



 
   





 


I enjoyed living on campus as it was convenient to walk to the Rec Center, The Kitchens, work, and enjoying the on-campus activities. I also enjoyed making connections with my roommates and creating memories in my college experience. This also helped me to be more involved on campus and to be more social with others as I feel that the villages helped build community and support. Being able to transition from high school to college with living on campus helped me to grow into being the person that I am today and shape my college experience.





Dirk Tolson | Statistics Major, Spanish and Computer Science Minor



 
   





 


Living on campus at Sonoma State has been nothing short of amazing! Being able to be in walking distance from my classes, having a full kitchen at my fingertips, and having the opportunity to chose how many people I want to share a room with. The community areas such as the pool or outside common areas allow me to meet new people and socialize! I highly recommend living on campus as I believe it enhances your overall experience as a student at SSU.





Ellie Zielsdorf | Communications Major
